frame.name: Contingency
frame.definition:
<def-root>The answer to one open question, the <fen>Outcome</fen>, is dictated (partially or completely) by the answer to another open question, the <fen>Determinant</fen>, i.e. if the answer to the <fen>Determinant</fen> is known, the answer to the <fen>Outcome</fen> can be predicted. The <fen>Degree</fen> of predictive power and the <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the dependency holds can also be expressed.
<ex><fex name="Outcome">Economic policy</fex> is <fex name="Degree">partially</fex> a <t>function</t> <fex name="Determinant">of cultural values</fex>.</ex> <ex>Well, <fex name="Outcome"><t>that</t></fex> <t>depends</t> ... <fex name="Determinant">DNI</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Circumstances">In Mediaeval times</fex>, <fex name="Outcome">status</fex> was <t>dependent</t> <fex name="Determinant">on birth</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Outcome
FE.definition:
<def-root>An open question that is (to some degree) predictable from the Determinant.
</def-root>

FE.name: Determinant
FE.definition:
<def-root>An open question that determines the <fen>Outcome</fen>.
<ex>Price, in such a case, <t>depends</t> <fex name="Determinant">only on the whim of the supplier</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The amount of predictive power supplied by the <fen>Determinant</fen> with respect to the <fen>Outcome</fen>.
<ex>His decision was <fex name="Degree">somewhat</fex> <t>dependent</t> on who won the game</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The conditions under which the <fen>Determinant</fen> dictates the <fen>Outcome</fen>. Oftentimes it is expressed in a fashion similar to Time and Place in other frames, but such cases are actually metonymic for the prevailing conditions of the Time and/or Place.
<ex><fex name="Circumstances">In London</fex>, how long it took to cross the city depended on how many state dinners were being served that night.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: depend.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be controlled or determined by.

lexUnit.name: function.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a variable quantity regarded as depending on another variable; a consequence

lexUnit.name: dependent.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: contingent on or determined by.

lexUnit.name: depends.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (something said in the immediate discourse) depends (on)

lexUnit.name: dependence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being dependent

lexUnit.name: hang_((on)).v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be contingent or dependent on

lexUnit.name: determine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to occur in a particular way; be the decisive factor in

lexUnit.name: independent.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: free from outside control; not subject to another's authority.

lexUnit.name: factor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a circumstance, fact, or influence that contributes to a result.

lexUnit.name: variable.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an uncertain fact that something else depends on.
